1:
I finish my hot, hot bath. 
My wet body feels so cool, cool, cool. 
What makes that happen?
Vayu, the wind!
2:
The milk in my cup is too hot. 
But soon it is ready for me to sip. 
Who makes that happen?
Vayu, the wind!
3:
The window curtains flutter and gently brush my face. 
Who makes it happen?
Vayu, the wind!
4:
A bolt of lightning far away. 
Black clouds moving my way. 
Who makes that happen?
Vayu, the wind!
5:
Branches sway and leaves tremble. 
Flowers gently fall. 
Who did it all?
Vayu, the wind!
6:
We are playing far from the house. 
Yet I can smell the food mother is preparing. 
Who makes it happen?
Vayu, the wind!
7:
A glass on a windowsill, crashes to the ground. 
I am glad I was not around. 
Who broke the glass?
It was Vayu, the wind!
8:
A whistle blows. A train rolls in. 
I cannot see it, but I hear its din. 
Who makes that happen?
Vayu, the wind!
9:
Cannot be seen. 
Cannot be heard. 
Works without saying a word. 
Who can it be?
Of course!
The wind.
